product_name: e.l.f. CosmeticsHalo Glow Skin Tint Mineral SPF 50
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeHSA/FSA eligibleSay "halo" to e.l.f.'s do-it-all Halo Glow Skin Tint that's worth every e.l.f.ing cent. Get light, buildable coverage with a dewy finish plus zinc oxide mineral SPF 50 sunscreen with no white cast. It sinks in like your fave skincare for a barely-there feel and naturally glowing complexion.
details: DetailsBenefitsHydrating skin tint delivers light, buildable coverage with a natural dewy finishBroad-spectrum mineral SPF 50 sun protection (UVA & UVB protection) with zero white castLightweight, serum-like feel sinks into skinDo-it-all skin tint: skincare, SPF 50 + coverageInfused with niacinamide, plus bisabol & allantoinAvailable in multiple flexible shades (6 shade families with 3 undertones each)Non-comedogenic & dermatologist-testedWater-resistant (80 minutes)Recommended by The Skin Cancer Foundation as safe & effective sun protectione.l.f. is double-certified cruelty-free by Leaping Bunny & PETAe.l.f. is proud to partner with Fair Trade USA & manufacture products in Fair Trade Certified facilities; look for the Fair Trade Certified seal on your e.l.f. productKey IngredientsZinc oxide (mineral SPF 50)Niacinamide helps brighten skin toneBisabolol helps soothe skinFormulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanItem 2639503How To UseShake wellApply skin tint using fingertips or e.l.f. Halo Glow Angled Silicone Sponge (sold separately)Apply more to build to your preferred coverage levelIngredients9 Medium Cool: Active: Zinc Oxide 12%.Inactive: Water, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Lauryl PEG-8 Dimethicone, Tridecyl Salicylate, Isododecane, Propanediol, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Dimethicone, Niacinamide, Caprylyl Methicone, C13-15 Alkane, Silica, Polyglyceryl-2 Dipolyhydroxystearate, Polyglyceryl-3 Polyricinoleate, Octyldodecyl Neopentanoate, Sodium Chloride, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Phenoxyethanol, Bisabolol, Lecithin, Caprylyl Glycol, Allantoin, Polyglyceryl-4 Diisostearate/Polyhydroxystearate/Sebacate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, Aluminum Hydroxide, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Sodium Hydroxide. May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499).Ingredients may change or vary from time to time. reviews.headline: yesss
reviews.comments: veryygood

reviews.headline: Pleasantly Suprised
reviews.comments: I was pleasantly surprised by how much I like this product.  The consistency is like a liquid foundation - not to heavy, not too light.  It blends easily with clean hands and coverage is moderate - just enough to camouflage my dark spots, without being too thick.  It is buildable if you want more coverage.  I was worried that it would be to 'glowy' for my combination skin, especially in my oily t-zone, but it's not.  I would call the finish dewy without being too shiny or oily.  The only thing to watch out for is the color matching.  In the elf camo cc cream, I am a light neutral (which is what I usually am with most foundations in other brands), however, in halo glow skin tint mineral SPF 50, I was a light, warm.  Wasn't a big deal since I exchange it, but something to consider when selecting your shade.  I would recommend this product.

reviews.headline: Love it but a sweat a lot on my face and it crease

reviews.headline: Awful
reviews.comments: Smells terrible

reviews.headline: AMAZING
reviews.comments:
Disclaimer: Long Review. I went into a lot of detail in the hopes of helping others considering buying this product. Please also remember that every single review posted is simply a matter of opinion and circumstance, and only you can decide what products suit your needs at the given price point :)

Let me start off by saying that I am currently a senior in college. I spent 1.5 hours of labor at my meager wage to purchase this product, and in no way is this sponsored. I saw that people were skeptical about the incentivized reviews, as was I.

Backstory: I enter my hometown Ulta while out on Summer break to use a coupon that was about to expire. As a broke college student, I headed straight for the "non-prestige" section. Enter this product. Initially, I was not expecting anything incredible. Though e.l.f. and I have a long track record, I never went out of my way to buy any of their foundations. My skin tone is apparently very hard to match, as most shades are either too warm or dark, and due to this I refuse to purchase any foundations online. Additionally, I have very oily skin, and it is VERY sensitive. I also hate the FEELING of makeup, and this is why I rarely wear any. I cannot stand the "heavy, cemented" feeling of most foundations, and avoid mascara and lashes all together.

The first thing I noticed about this product was the packaging. Pink-- which appeals to my "girly" aesthetic. (I will mention, though, that you cannot just sit the bottle down in the middle of use like you can with most others. I have no idea why they decided to make the opening face downwards...)

I pick it up, thinking that the shade will be too yellow/warm like always. I put a little drop on the back of my hand and... the shade match is PERFECT. When I tell y'all this is the first time I have ever had a foundation do this... I teared up on the spot. I realize this is a rare occasion and might not happen for everyone, which is why I vouch for always trying on bases in store. The formula was very liquid-y, in the best way possible. It quite literally feels like a serum and is exactly what I was looking for. I researched the poor reviews and was concerned that what I was reading was not lining up with the product I had in hand. I decided to purchase it anyway, and I am so glad that I did.

Do not get me wrong, this product is no Shape Tape. It's no Double Wear. It is a very lightweight, low-medium coverage serum like foundation that evens skin tone. As someone with very sensitive skin, I love how I can put this product on and have the look of makeup but the feeling of a bare face. It is INCREDIBLE. You do have to put a generoud amount on for heavier coverage, but it is so worth it imo. Before this product, I was using Morphe Skin Tint, which is similar but with a thicker consistency and subpar shade match (it tended to oxidize and turn too warm after application).

It blends nicely, is not cakey at all, and stays pretty well. I tested it several times in different conditions. It stayed on during my apartment move-in day in southern LA (110 heat index), a 20 minute shower, and an 8 hour shift at work. In my opinion, this is the best foundation I have tried, and I will be a repeat customer. 

While I am no make-up guru, I wanted to share a small list of the products I use for other girlies out there who like the look of make-up but not the feeling:

- Tatcha The Silk Canvas Filter Primer (goes on sale 50% off around Black Friday/Prime Day)
- This foundation
- Rare Beauty Soft Pinch Liquid Blush ("a dot is a lot" rule from elementary school applies nicely here)
- e.l.f. Halo Glow Contour Beauty Wand
- NYX Professional Makeup Pro Fix Stick Color Correcting Concealer
- Clinique Stay Matte Sheer Pressed Powder

For $18, I highly recommend this product. I am genuinely confused by the negative reviews, and encourage you to check this out in store if possible :)

reviews.comments:
I was on the fence about getting this, but I am so glad I did! I did get a bit too dark of a shade, but that's on me. I absolutely love this formula!
I used the triple bounce serum, glow drops, and the invisible sunscreen primer them added the Maybelline grippy primer as a bas and it is chefs kiss! sits beautifully on my 46 year old skin.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product every time!!
reviews.comments: It's like skin care in a bottle!

reviews.headline: i wanted to love it but‚Ä¶..
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this product, I had seen very good reviews and thought it would be the perfect glowy sunscreen. I have tried many elf products some of which I use very often (hydrogrip primer, and glowscreen dupe). I dont know if its just because I got to light of a shade or what but I did not like it! I have primarily dry skin and that probably was part of the problem and i did use skin prep but when I put it on it was very cakey and dry lokking.I would not recommend this product!!

reviews.headline: Color range is lacking
reviews.comments: It was hard to find a decent match, and even then the product was not what was described for me. It creased even trying it with primer and different amounts.

reviews.headline: Not for my sensitive skin
reviews.comments: It's just not for my skin; maybe others will like it.  It goes on easily and I liked the little bit of coverage I got.  But it made me itch....

reviews.headline: I hated it
reviews.comments: I hated this so much. It would be hard to define why. Everything from the texture, and the look, to the smell. I didn't like anything about it. I tried it a second time just to be sure, and hated it so much i had to immediately wash it off. It's just not for me.

reviews.headline: 100% my new go to!
reviews.comments: I wore this all week at Sturgis bike rally and burned everywhere but on my face. 1 application before a full day of riding and never had a hint of sunburn once. Great buildable coverage and perfect color match for someone who typically has to mix 2 colors. 100% will be my new go too. The only thing I'm typically leery of a runny foundation but with the results from this I'll deal.

reviews.headline: Absolutely love
reviews.comments: I have dry skin and quite a bit of hyperpigmentation. In my opinion this is a medium/high medium coverage depending if I do a thin second layer.  it looks like my skin and does not feel heavy at all. im assuming if you have a more oily skin type you may not like this as much as I do! I have shade 4 and it's a perfect match for my self tan. I've been reaching for it everyday and I have like 20 different foundations! I love this stuff.

reviews.headline: I 100% recommend this!
reviews.comments: I have very very dry and sensitive skin so my skin is really red most of the time. I wanted something to cover up my redness but wasn't to expensive and this is PERFECT! It doesn't irritate my sensitive skin and gives the perfect no makeup look on ur skin! 100% WOULD recommend

reviews.headline: My new favorite
reviews.comments: I love wearing makeup but not in the summer. This has become the base of a quick face. This is everything!! I love how light it is and it enhances the glowy tanned summer look. I went out of my way to leave a review because its THAT GOOD.

reviews.headline: I didn't care for this product
reviews.comments: The idea of an e.l.f. skin tint with SPF 50 seems great, as I am an e.l.f. fan!!!  I just didn't like this product.  I think it looked cakey on my face, even after good skin prep.  I have normal, mature skin and I wanted to love it, I just didn't.

reviews.headline: I didnt like it
reviews.comments: Didn't  like the texture.

reviews.headline: Recommend
reviews.comments: This pairs soooo nice with the holy hydration face cream. Honestly I feel the bad reviews are because the skin wasnt prepped before use. This leaves my skin so smooth and doesnt feel heavy. Looks good all day.

reviews.headline: Not a tint.
reviews.comments: Full coverage in my opinion. Cakey and definitely not for me.

reviews.headline: Would not repurchase
reviews.comments: I got it specifically for the sunscreen in it. I put it on and slid right off it did not stay on my skin at all not waterproof in the slighest would not buy again

faceoff_positive.comments: This skin tint goes on super smooth and offers up great UV protection! I opted for a shade darker than my normal tone, which allows for an extra tint that makes me look tan. Definitely a great makeup incorporation!
faceoff_positive.headline: Great SPF base!!

faceoff_negative.comments: As a disclaimer, I received this for free as part of an ELF campaign in exchange for an honest review. At the time I received the offer, I went with something more along the lines of my winter shade. As a neutral medium deep girl that prefers to match to her neck/chest, it's hard to find shades that hit both my undertone and shade. I didn't realize however this would have zinc oxide (known to leave a white cast on darker skin tones). I would recommend that a) you match to your face if you typically match your foundation to somewhere else and b) consider trying a shade darker than you think. Based on the swatches, I assumed I would be a 10N but it seems I should have gone with the tan cool/deep neutral. It's hard to tell in the pictures but I had a pretty bad white cast when I used the amount recommended for sunscreen application. I suspect that the white cast would still be the case even if I was using this at my palest in the middle of winter. The only other thing is that you should wait to apply this after your skincare. The product seemed to separate weird when I applied it almost immediately after my moisturizer. It also seemed to struggle under makeup unless I really waited a good bit. It's a big shame because this feels nice on the skin when worn alone! I enjoyed wearing it out when I wanted a little bit of coverage but didn't have time to do a heavier makeup look. The skin tint definitely gives skin when it's blended out. I will note that it lasts but not necessarily all day if you're an oily skin girl like me. I'd recommend this for a quick on the go look if you can find your right shade.
faceoff_negative.headline: Shade match is deceiving which is a shame
